perturbation.original_text: 4.2 Payment for the Products shall be in U.S. Dollars, or such other currency as STAAR may require in its sole discretion, and made within thirty (30) days of STAAR’s invoice. Late payments shall be subject to an interest charge of 1% per month or the maximum amount permitted by applicable law, whichever is less.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 Payment for the Products shall be in U.S. Dollars, or such other currency as STAAR may require in its sole discretion, and made within sixty (60) days of STAAR’s invoice. Late payments shall be subject to an interest charge of 1% per month or the maximum amount permitted by applicable law, whichever is less.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a conflict in payment terms. Section 4.2 now states payment is due within 60 days of the invoice, conflicting with the original 30-day period specified in the same section. This creates uncertainty about the actual payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: 7.3 During each Contract Year, as defined below, Distributor shall purchase from STAAR the minimum quantity of each Product that shall be mutually agreed between the parties in advance of the applicable Contract Year (“Minimum Product Quantities”). The Minimum Purchase Quantities for the Contract Year are as set forth on Exhibit B attached hereto. Within ninety (90) days prior to the expiration of each Contract Year, the parties will discuss in good faith and agree on the Minimum Product Quantities for the successive Contract Year; provided, however, that, if the parties fail to reach agreement on or otherwise specify the Minimum Purchase Quantities for the successive Contract Year, the Minimum Product Quantities for such successive Contract Year shall be __________ percent (___%) of the Minimum Purchase Quantities for the existing Contract Year. “Contract Year” means for the first Contract Year of the Agreement, the period commencing on the Effective Date hereof and ending one year thereafter and for subsequent Contract Years, the successive twelve (12) month period thereafter. Failure of Distributor to purchase the Minimum Purchase Quantities for any Contract Year, shall be considered a material breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.3 During each Contract Year, as defined below, Distributor shall purchase from STAAR the minimum quantity of each Product that shall be mutually agreed between the parties in advance of the applicable Contract Year (“Minimum Product Quantities”). The Minimum Purchase Quantities for the Contract Year are as set forth on Exhibit B attached hereto. Within ninety (90) days prior to the expiration of each Contract Year, the parties will discuss in good faith and agree on the Minimum Product Quantities for the successive Contract Year; provided, however, that, if the parties fail to reach agreement on or otherwise specify the Minimum Purchase Quantities for the successive Contract Year, the Minimum Product Quantities for such successive Contract Year shall be negotiated and decided by STAAR alone, and communicated to the Distributor. “Contract Year” means for the first Contract Year of the Agreement, the period commencing on the Effective Date hereof and ending one year thereafter and for subsequent Contract Years, the successive twelve (12) month period thereafter. Failure of Distributor to purchase the Minimum Purchase Quantities for any Contract Year, shall be considered a material breach of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a conflict regarding the Minimum Product Quantities. Initially, it requires mutual agreement. The modified text allows STAAR to unilaterally determine the quantities if an agreement isn't reached. This contradicts the initial requirement for mutual agreement, creating uncertainty and potentially disputes over the quantities and breach of contract.

perturbation.original_text: 14.3 Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 3 above, either party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement, without cause, upon no less than ninety (90) days’ prior written notice to the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: 14.3 Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 3 above, either party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement, without cause, upon no less than thirty (30) days’ prior written notice to the other party.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a conflict by altering the notice period required for termination without cause. Originally, it was 90 days, but now it's 30 days. This in-text contradiction introduces ambiguity and could lead to disputes about the legally required notice period for termination.
